thread.title: Tuberville's salary ranks 50th among NCAA football coaches
thread.title_full: Tuberville's salary ranks 50th among NCAA football coaches

title: Tuberville's salary ranks 50th among NCAA football coaches
text:
Tuberville's salary ranks 50th among NCAA football coaches Dave Clark , dclark@cincinnati.com 4:33 p.m. EDT October 8, 2015 Bearcats head coach Tommy Tuberville smiles during practice in August. (Photo: The Enquirer/Sam Greene) 20 CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
UC Bearcats head coach Tommy Tuberville's salary ranks 50th among NCAA football head coaches, according to USA Today . 
Tuberville earns a base salary of $2,200,000 from the school. His max bonus, according to USA Today, is $540,000, which reports that his bonuses paid for 2014-15 amounted to $140,000. 
Tuberville's salary is ranked the highest among AAC head coaches. Central Florida's George O'Leary ranks second in the AAC - 57th overall - at $1,890,000 in total pay. 
Last year , Tuberville's salary ranked 44th according to the USA Today coaching salary database. 
Nick Saban ($7,087,481) of Alabama has the highest total pay, and the Ohio State Buckeyes' Urban Meyer ($5,860,000) has the third highest. 
Related: Wisconsin chancellor says Michigan, Ohio State overpaying coaches 
Former UC head coach Mark Dantonio - now at Michigan State - ranks 21st overall with $3,671,520 in total pay. Former Bearcats head coach Butch Jones - now at Tennessee - ranks 23rd with $3,633,000 in total pay. Notre Dame's Brian Kelly, Jones' predecessor at UC, ranks 68th overall ($1,187,272). 
Among other coaches of regional interest, Kentucky's Mark Stoops ranks 27th ($3,263,600), and Miami University's Chuck Martin ranks 109th ($450,000).
